reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Improve Household WASH conditions for war affected families in the Gaza Strip

description.narrative: The project aims at improving the WASH facilities at 815 war affected households in 20 locations in Gaza Strip to make sure that the access of nearly 4882 inhabitants of which 1252 are women to essential wash services is improved . The number of beneficiaries in each location can be summarized as follows: Al Buraij Camp - 225, Al Maghazi Camp 316, Al Musaddar - 90, Wadi El Salqa-270, Deir El Balah-180, Gaza area- 1121, Al Mughraqa - 180. Juhr Eddik-180, Al Qarya El Badawiya-270, Beit Hanoun-450, Beit Lahia-225, Abasan Al Jadida- 67, Abasan al Kabira-90, Al Fukhari-180, Al Qarara-136, Bani Suhaila-90, Khuza'a-90, Shokat Assoufi-316 and Rafah-316. The project will install 1000 wash basin, 500 unit from each of the following items: Kitchen sink, modern toilet, squat toilet, shower mixer and wash basin mixer. In addition it will install 2000 water tap and 815 HDPE water tank of 1500 liter volume. The project will also target all beneficiaries in the target households to raise their awareness on the main public health and wash issues. The project will ensure that all target houses are properly disposing their sewage and that no spillover is occurring causing any public health risk to the inhabitants of the house as well as surrounding people. Also to ensure preventing environmental pollution to ensure no harm principle. The project design has considered gender mainstreaming and also mainstreaming of protection principles including meaningful access, safety and dignity. It will be implemented by PHG in cooperation with RWDS and Yabus society in full participation of stakeholders and beneficiaries, with emphasis on the participation of women in the project committee as well as in finalizing the needs so that women needs are considered in the interventions. PHG, RWDS and Yabus will jointly select final list of beneficiaries. They will adhere to the protection principles throughout the implementation of the project and will develop protection monitoring, vulnerability mapping and impact assessment to ensure project compliance with these principles. RWDS will implement the awareness activities in 8 locations in Middle area and in Gaza with total beneficiaries of 2652 persons while Yabus will implement the awareness activities in 8 areas in Khan Younis and Rafah with total beneficiaries of 1285 persons. In the mean time PHG will implement the installation of wash facilities in the target households and will conduct the awareness in North Gaza for a total number of beneficiaries of 945 persons. PHG will also coordinate the project implementation with RWDS and Yabus and will be responsible for the its overall management and reporting toward the donor. PHG will ensure the quality implementation and management of project in accordance with its ISO9001 - 2008 standards. PHG in cooperation with RWDS and Yabus will also ensure the timely implementation of the project in an efficient manner within the budget limit and will allocate relevant qualified human resources to implement it properly.
